revised_title: Morphometric Analysis of Hoverflies: Patterns in Size and Shape
tldr: The author conducted a morphometric analysis of 13 variables in 250 hoverfly species to understand the patterns of variation in their size and shape. The study found that the main difference between species lies in proboscis length relative to body size, and within species, sexual dimorphism is associated with differences in abdomen width. The research used multivariate techniques, such as canonical variates analysis and principal components analysis, to identify the major axes of variation within and between species.
